name: Blakes Wood to Lingwood Common Walk, Danbury

ai.summary: A gentle 4.5 km route from Blakes Wood to Lingwood Common in Danbury, weaving through woodland and open countryside with lakeside views. Designed as an easy, family-friendly walk suitable for casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: The route is mostly flat and on well-trodden paths through Blakes Wood and surrounding land, with some grassy or damp sections. Expect occasional muddy patches after rain and a few short, uneven stretches; surfaced paths and gentle boardwalks keep the walk accessible.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and close gates where encountered. Wear sturdy footwear and be prepared for mud or uneven ground. Check weather and daylight; carry a map or offline navigation. Bring water, a small first aid kit, and insect repellent. Be mindful of livestock on open ground and supervise children or pets closely. Let someone know your plan and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: All year, with spring and summer offering the best scenery and drier trails; autumn can be very pleasant too, while winter walks may be muddier.

seo.title: Blakes Wood to Lingwood Common Walk, Danbury – 4.5 km Easy Trail
seo.meta_description: Discover a gentle 4.5 km hike from Blakes Wood to Lingwood Common in Danbury, UK. Easy terrain, lakeside scenery, and woodland paths—perfect for a family-friendly day out.
seo.h1: Blakes Wood to Lingwood Common Walk, Danbury
